author: @prensagrafica
title: Â¿CÃ³mo el consumo de zanahorias puede combatir el cÃ¡ncer y los males de la vejez?
text:
Â¿CÃ³mo el consumo de zanahorias puede combatir el cÃ¡ncer y los males de la vejez?
Lectura 3:00 min
Lectura 3:00 min
El consumo constante de zanahorias crudas podrÃ­a proteger contra el cÃ¡ncer de pulmÃ³n y otros tipos, ademÃ¡s de ralentizar el envejecimiento de la piel.
La zanahoria es una hortaliza dulce y versÃ¡til, que puede comerse sola, en arroz o ensaladas, como batidos, sopas, entre muchas otras preparaciones. AdemÃ¡s de tener un buen sabor, los estudios indican que puede tener un
gran aporte en la salud.
Uno de los beneficios mÃ¡s conocidos de este vegetal es que puede promover una visiÃ³n saludable. De acuerdo con el portal de salud â€˜Healthâ€™, tiene un alto contenido de vitamina A, la cual trabaja como un antioxidante protector de cÃ©lulas.
â€œIncluso puede ayudar a proteger contra la degeneraciÃ³n macular relacionada con la edad y el sarampiÃ³n. Una deficiencia de vitamina A puede provocar una afecciÃ³n llamada xeroftalmia, que puede daÃ±ar la visiÃ³n normal y provocar ceguera nocturnaâ€, indicÃ³ el artÃ­culo, revisado mÃ©dicamente por la dietista Suzanne Fisher.
AdemÃ¡s, las investigaciones indican que puede ayudar a combatir el cÃ¡ncer. Un estudio publicado en los Institutos Nacionales de la Salud confirmÃ³ que el consumo constante de
zanahorias crudas podrÃ­a proteger contra el cÃ¡ncer de pulmÃ³n y otros tipos.
â€œEsta cohorte de 57,000 ciudadanos daneses fue seguida durante mÃ¡s de 20 aÃ±os mediante cuestionarios ampliados y controles clÃ­nicos. Hemos demostrado, anteriormente, que los ciudadanos que comen zanahorias crudas tienen un riesgo reducido de desarrollar cÃ¡ncer colorrectalâ€, concluyeron.
SegÃºn â€˜Healthâ€™, esto se debe a su alto contenido de antioxidantes. EspecÃ­ficamente, el carotenoide llamado betacaroteno podrÃ­a reducir el cÃ¡ncer de pulmÃ³n, colorrectal, prÃ³stata y leucemia.
â€œLas zanahorias tambiÃ©n contienen otro carotenoide llamado licopeno. El licopeno tiene el potencial de combatir el cÃ¡ncer, como el de estÃ³mago, prÃ³stata, pulmÃ³n y mama, y tambiÃ©n puede estar relacionado con la salud vascular y la prevenciÃ³n de trastornos cardiovascularesâ€, agregÃ³ el artÃ­culo.
AdemÃ¡s, podrÃ­a reducir los efectos de la edad. Su contenido de vitamina A podrÃ­a proteger las cÃ©lulas del daÃ±o del sol. La deficiencia de esta sustancia podrÃ­a causar resequedad en la piel, cabello y uÃ±as.
â€œEs un nutriente que ayuda a mantener la piel sana y no tener suficiente aumenta el riesgo de sufrir problemas cutÃ¡neos como hiperqueratosis, una afecciÃ³n que provoca piel seca y escamosa. Como antioxidante, el betacaroteno puede ayudar a proteger la piel de las quemaduras solares y ayudar a ralentizar el envejecimiento de la piel al mejorar la elasticidad, la hidrataciÃ³n, la textura, las arrugas y las manchas de la edadâ€, explicÃ³ â€˜WebMDâ€™ en un artÃ­culo revisado por la doctora Jabeen Begum.
Estos son otros de los beneficios de las zanahorias, segÃºn el artÃ­culo:
- Pueden estimular el sistema inmune y construir anticuerpos para defenderlo.
- Su alto porcentaje en fibra podrÃ­a ayudar con el estreÃ±imiento y controlar la diabetes, ya que podrÃ­an mantener los niveles de azÃºcar en la sangre bajo control.
- Tienen un contenido en calcio y vitamina K podrÃ­a fortalecer los huesos.
Contraindicaciones
Recuerde consultar con un especialista de la salud antes de incorporar nuevos ingredientes en su alimentaciÃ³n.
De acuerdo con â€˜Medical News Todayâ€™, el consumo excesivo de fibra podrÃ­a causar estreÃ±imiento, hinchazÃ³n y otros problemas gastrointestinales.
AdemÃ¡s, algunas personas podrÃ­an ser alÃ©rgicas a la zanahoria. â€œCualquier persona que desarrolle urticaria, hinchazÃ³n y dificultad para respirar despuÃ©s de comer zanahorias necesita atenciÃ³n mÃ©dica urgenteâ€, advirtiÃ³ el portal de salud.

author: MIGUEL SALGADO REBOREDA
title: â€œEstaba seguro de que Ã­bamos a tener una acogida mejor que en otros lugaresâ€ - Faro de Vigo
text: â€œEstaba seguro de que Ã­bamos a tener una acogida mejor que en otros lugaresâ€ El contraalmirante Gonzalo Villar agradece el gran recibimiento que ha tenido el grupo anfibio DÃ©dalo 24 por la ciudadanÃ­a MIGUEL SALGADO REBOREDA El desembarco del Grupo DÃ©dalo 24 ha despertado pasiones en la ciudad. En su primer dÃ­a de visita, por los tres buques amarrados en el Muelle de TrasatlÃ¡nticos pasaron mÃ¡s de 7.000 personas. No obstante, el plato fuerte de la expediciÃ³n serÃ¡ esta tarde, cuando los quinientos infantes realizarÃ¡n un ejercicio propio de una pelÃ­cula bÃ©lica en el arenal de Samil. El contraalmirante de la Armada y lÃ­der de todo el Grupo de Combate Expedicionario, Gonzalo Villar, agradeciÃ³ en nombre de todos los integrantes la gran acogida que han tenido en estos dÃ­as. Haber escogido Vigo para atracar y no otros puntos de la zona de las RÃ­as Baixas fue muy especial para el contraalmirante. Ã‰l es conocedor de la estrecha relaciÃ³n existente entre la localidad olÃ­vica y la Armada de primera mano, ya que fue en la ETEA â€“la antigua Escuela de Transmisiones ElÃ©ctricas de la Armadaâ€“ donde realizÃ³ su especializaciÃ³n en comunicaciones, y estaba seguro de que la acogida por parte de los habitantes iba a ser mejor que en otros puntos de la geografÃ­a nacional. En lo referente a la exhibiciÃ³n, Gonzalo Villar explicÃ³ cÃ³mo va a ser el evento aeronaval en la Playa de Samil. â€œSerÃ¡ parecido al a hecho en GijÃ³n por el â€˜DÃ­a de las Fuerzas Armadasâ€™, mostrando todas las acciones propias de un desembarco anfibioâ€, afirmaba el lÃ­der de la misiÃ³n. ParticiparÃ¡n infantes de Marina, vehÃ­culos, embarcaciones de desembarco, aviones y helicÃ³pteros para que la gente no solo vea los buques, sino que pueda hacerse una idea de cÃ³mo se utilizan los instrumentos en los distintos ejercicios militares. El pasado 3 de abril, las tres embarcaciones comenzaron una travesÃ­a en Rota (CÃ¡diz), que este prÃ³ximo domingo llega a su fin. Esta aventura se ha dividido en dos partes: una primera ruta hasta Estambul y una segunda desde la capital turca hasta Helsinki, en el mar BÃ¡ltico. Ha sido el despliegue marino mÃ¡s largo de la historia de la Armada, al recorrer todo el frente marÃ­timo de la OTAN. Las actividades durante este tiempo han estado centradas en demostrar las capacidades de acciÃ³n en contacto con todas las unidades del organismo supranacional, incluyendo Suecia y Finlandia, Ãºltimas incorporaciones. El [BNG](https://www.farodevigo.es/tags/bng/) rechaza las maniobras que â€œalientan el belicismoâ€ [Xabier PÃ©rez Iglesias](https://www.farodevigo.es/elecciones/municipales/candidatos/vigo/xabier-perez-iglesias-84777342.html), portavoz del [Bloque Nacionalista Galego](https://www.farodevigo.es/tags/bng/) en Vigo, ha mostrado su disconformidad con la exhibiciÃ³n de hoy al catalogarla como un â€œacto irracional para el medioambiente que forma parte del discurso belicista empujado desde la OTAN, asumido con obediencia servil por el Gobierno espaÃ±olâ€. El polÃ­tico viguÃ©s tambiÃ©n mostrÃ³ su contrariedad por â€œhacer de la guerra un juego, frivolizando sobre el drama humano que realmente es, en pleno contexto de conflictos en Ucrania e Gazaâ€. author: MarketScreener
title: US diplomacy in Mideast falters as clock ticks down for Biden - MarketScreener
text:
WASHINGTON (Reuters) - U.S. efforts to secure a Gaza ceasefire remain stalled after nearly a year of fighting. Iran-backed Houthi rebels continue to attack Red Sea shipping. And now, despite intense U.S.-led diplomacy, the Israel-Hezbollah conflict threatens to flare into an all-out regional war.
With the clock ticking on his administration, U.S. President Joe Biden faces an arc of Middle East crises likely to defy solution before he leaves office in January and which look all but certain to tarnish his foreign policy legacy, analysts and foreign diplomats say.
Biden has struggled over the past year to thread the needle of embracing Israel's right to self-defense against Palestinian Hamas militants in Gaza and the Hezbollah group in Lebanon while trying to contain civilian casualties and prevent a spiral into a broader Middle East conflict.
Time and again he has confronted the shortcomings of that strategy, the latest being Israel's rejection on Thursday of a U.S.-backed proposal for a 21-day truce across the Lebanon border as it pressed ahead with strikes that have killed hundreds of Lebanese.
"What we're seeing are the limits of U.S. power and influence in the Middle East," said Jonathan Panikoff, the U.S. government's former deputy national intelligence officer for the region.
Perhaps the clearest example of that trend has been Biden's reluctance to exercise much U.S. leverage - as Israel's top arms supplier and diplomatic shield at the United Nations - to bend Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu to Washington's will.
For nearly a year the United States has sought unsuccessfully to help broker a deal between Israel and Hamas to halt the fighting and free hostages taken by the militants in their Oct. 7 cross-border rampage that triggered the Gaza war.
No breakthrough is imminent, say people familiar with the matter.
U.S. officials are quick to pin blame for failed negotiations on Hamas but some also cite Netanyahu's shifting demands.
During U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken's nine trips to the region since Oct. 7, the top U.S. diplomat several times found himself at odds with senior Israeli leaders.
In one instance last November, Blinken at a news conference urged Israel to pause its military offensive in Gaza to allow aid to enter the Palestinian enclave. Moments later, Netanyahu rejected the idea in a televised statement, saying he had made clear to Blinken that Israel was continuing with its operation "full force."
The White House did not immediately respond to a request for comment for this story.
U.S. CREDIBILITY AT STAKE
Biden has been credited by fellow Western leaders with reinvigorating key U.S. alliances, including with NATO and top Asian partners, after his White House predecessor, Donald Trump, questioned the value of such relationships.
That was demonstrated in April when the Biden administration marshalled support from regional and European partners to help defend Israel from an Iranian drone and missile attack.
But some foreign diplomats say Biden's handling of the volatile Middle East, especially his response to the Gaza war, has frayed U.S. credibility abroad.
"President Biden's original blunder was to say the U.S. will, no matter what, stand for Israel," one Western official said. "We have never recovered from that."
A Middle East diplomat said U.S. diplomacy had "failed to impress adversaries" and noted that Biden sent military assets to the region after Oct. 7 as a warning to Iran and its proxy groups but that it did not seem to deter them completely.
Yemen's Iran-backed Houthi rebels have kept up a steady barrage of missile attacks on commercial shipping in the Red Sea despite Biden and other Western leaders providing warships for beefed-up protection.
"He could have been quicker to respond and more severe to these attacks by proxy forces," said Michael 'Mick' Mulroy, a former deputy assistant secretary of defense for the Middle East under the Trump administration.
U.S. officials have repeatedly pushed back on such criticism, saying their diplomacy has made a difference for the better and that the U.S. military deployment to the region had helped so far to avert a spillover from Gaza into a regional war.
"Diplomacy is not a matter of snapping our fingers and - voila," U.S. Ambassador to the U.N. Linda Thomas-Greenfield told the Security Council earlier this month. "It takes hard work. It takes effort and, unfortunately, it takes time. It has not failed."
Even so, since Oct. 7, Biden has seen his hopes dashed for what was once touted as a potential signature foreign policy achievement - normalization of relations between Israel and Saudi Arabia coupled with U.S. security guarantees for Riyadh.
At the United Nations, where the Security Council in June backed Biden's plan for a Gaza ceasefire-hostage deal, there are signs that patience with U.S. Middle East diplomacy has waned.
Jordan's Foreign Minister Ayman Safadi said on Thursday that efforts to stop the violence in the Middle East constituted "a year of failure" and that if the Israeli government was not held to account it was not going to listen to international law, "and it's not even listening to its friends, including the U.S."
Panikoff, the former intelligence official now at the Atlantic Council think-tank in Washington, described the crux of the Biden administration's Gaza dilemma as: "Plan A hasn't worked for months. So where's Plan B?"
With Israel threatening a ground offensive in Lebanon and vowing to keep pressure on Iran-backed Hezbollah until thousands of Israeli evacuees can return to their homes in the north, the crisis there could also deepen.
The trajectory of the Lebanon conflict could have further implications not only for Biden's legacy but by extension the presidential campaign of Vice President Kamala Harris. Some Democratic progressive voters are already angry over unflinching U.S. support for Israel.
It remains to be seen whether Netanyahu will heed Biden's entreaties to avoid further escalation in Lebanon.
As a lame duck president in his final four months in office, analysts say Biden cannot be faulted for keeping up his efforts to ease Middle East turmoil - but they expect his successor to inherit the current crises.
(Reporting by Matt Spetalnick John Irish and Humeyra Pamuk; Additional reporting by Michelle Nichols, Phil Stewart and Simon Lewis; Writing by Matt Spetalnick; Editing by Don Durfee and Daniel Wallis)
By Matt Spetalnick, John Irish and Humeyra Pamuk
Share Â© Reuters - 2024

author: Grace O'Connor - Health & Science Editor
title: Rocket Media Lab Health Report: Matichon Online Insights
text:
Rising Kidney Disease Rates in Thailand: A Growing Health Crisis Bangkok, Thailand â€“ A concerning trend is emerging in Thailandâ€™s public health landscape: a dramatic increase in chronic kidney disease (CKD) cases, now surpassing even cancer in terms of years of healthy life lost. New data and expert warnings highlight the urgent need for preventative measures and improved healthcare access.
Recent reports indicate that Thai citizens are experiencing a decline in healthy years lived due to kidney ailments at an alarming rate. This escalating health challenge is prompting medical professionals to emphasize the critical role of lifestyle modifications, particularly regarding diet and the management of underlying conditions like diabetes and hypertension.
The Silent Epidemic: Understanding Chronic Kidney Disease Chronic kidney disease is a progressive condition where the kidneys lose their ability to filter waste and excess fluids from the blood. Often developing slowly over time, it can remain asymptomatic in its early stages, earning it the moniker â€œsilent epidemic.â€ This delayed detection contributes to the severity of the problem, as individuals may not seek medical attention until the disease has advanced significantly.
Several factors contribute to the rising incidence of CKD in Thailand. A growing prevalence of diabetes and high blood pressure, coupled with dietary habits rich in sugar and processed foods, are major drivers. The increasing aging population also plays a role, as kidney function naturally declines with age. Furthermore, access to regular health screenings and early intervention programs remains a challenge in certain regions.
According to experts at Maharaj Nakorn Sri Hospital, controlling blood pressure and blood sugar levels are paramount in preventing and managing kidney disease. Regular monitoring and adherence to prescribed medications are crucial for individuals at risk. However, proactive lifestyle changes, including adopting a healthy diet and maintaining a regular exercise routine, are equally important.
The impact of CKD extends beyond individual health. The economic burden on the healthcare system is substantial, with dialysis and kidney transplantation representing significant costs. Moreover, the loss of productivity due to illness and disability further exacerbates the societal impact.
What role does diet play in kidney health, and how can individuals make informed choices to protect their renal function? Are current public health initiatives sufficient to address this growing crisis, or are more comprehensive strategies needed?
Rocket Media Lab has recently published a comprehensive health situation report, providing further insights into the current state of kidney health in Thailand. Read the full report here .
The link between excessive sugar consumption and kidney damage is becoming increasingly clear. Prachatai reports on the risks of sweets for kidney health .
Symptoms indicating overworked kidneys should not be ignored. Vietnam.vn details warning signs to watch for .
The alarming statistic that Thai people are losing healthy years to chronic kidney disease three times faster than 30 years ago is a stark warning. MGR Online provides a detailed analysis of this trend .
Medical professionals emphasize the importance of proactive kidney health management. TheCoverage.info shares insights from kidney disease specialists .
Pro Tip: Regular check-ups, especially if you have diabetes, hypertension, or a family history of kidney disease, are vital for early detection and intervention. Frequently Asked Questions About Kidney Disease What are the early warning signs of chronic kidney disease? Early stages of kidney disease often have no noticeable symptoms. However, as the condition progresses, symptoms may include fatigue, swelling in the ankles and feet, changes in urination, and persistent itching.
How can I prevent kidney disease? Maintaining a healthy lifestyle, including a balanced diet, regular exercise, and controlling blood pressure and blood sugar levels, can significantly reduce your risk of developing kidney disease.
Is kidney disease treatable? While there is no cure for chronic kidney disease, it can be managed effectively with medication, lifestyle changes, and, in some cases, dialysis or kidney transplantation.
What is the role of diet in managing kidney disease? A kidney-friendly diet typically involves limiting sodium, potassium, and phosphorus intake, as well as controlling protein consumption. Consulting with a registered dietitian is recommended.
Are there any new advancements in kidney disease treatment? Research is ongoing to develop new and improved treatments for kidney disease, including novel medications and regenerative therapies. Stay informed about the latest advancements through reputable medical sources.
The rising rates of kidney disease in Thailand represent a significant public health challenge. Addressing this crisis requires a multi-faceted approach, including preventative measures, improved healthcare access, and increased public awareness.
Share this article to help raise awareness about kidney health and empower individuals to take proactive steps to protect their renal function. Join the conversation in the comments below â€“ what steps are you taking to prioritize your kidney health?
Disclaimer: This article provides general information and should not be considered medical advice. Please consult with a qualified healthcare professional for any health concerns or before making any decisions related to your health or treatment.

author: Especial
title: Pumas firma al 'Mejor jugador de Concacaf': Adalberto Carrasquilla es fichaje oficial para el CL2025
text:
ContinÃºan los movimientos dentro del mercado de invierno, y Pumas por fin ha hecho oficial el fichaje del panameÃ±o Adalberto Carasquilla, quien fue nombrado como â€˜Mejor jugador de Concacaf 2023-24â€², siendo uno de los grandes bombazos para el Clausura 2025.
El equipo universitario, asÃ­ como los otros 17 clubes, estÃ¡n buscando afinar a sus plantillas de cara a la pelea por el tÃ­tulo, pues con la Jornada 2 a punto de iniciar, esperan que todos estÃ©n conectados para los momentos mÃ¡s importantes.
Te recomendamos: Norteamericanos REACCIONAN al AmÃ©rica vs Inter Miami: â€˜Mascherano deberÃ¡ EVITAR la GOLEADAâ€™
Adalberto Carrasquilla ya es de Pumas
A travÃ©s de un comunicado, Pumas hizo oficial el fichaje de Adalberto Carrasquilla, mejor conocido como â€˜Cocoâ€™, mediocampista de 26 aÃ±os, con experiencia internacional en selecciÃ³n y que es la segunda contrataciÃ³n del club.
â€œCarrasquilla, de 26 aÃ±os de edad, cuenta con una extensa trayectoria tanto en clubes como en selecciones nacionales. DespuÃ©s de haber debutado con el Tauro de su paÃ­s, donde militÃ³ de 2015 a 2019, partiÃ³ a Europa para enrolarse en el FC Cartagena, hasta 2021. Ese aÃ±o partiÃ³ a los Estados Unidos para formar parte del Houston Dynamo, de la MLSâ€, se lee.
Â¡QuÃ© xopa PanamÃ¡, ya llegÃ³ el Coco! ðŸ’£ðŸ‡µðŸ‡¦
â€” PUMAS (@PumasMX)
Para el Clausura 2025 ha llegado un refuerzo desde PanamÃ¡, nombrado el mejor jugador de la Concacaf en 2023-2024, aterrizÃ³ en los Pumas, visiÃ³n de campo, desequilibrio y goles viene a aportar al conjunto universitario.
Bienvenido,â€¦[pic.twitter.com/V9oWEtMXEt][January 16, 2025]
Entre el palmarÃ©s que tiene â€˜Cocoâ€™, se encuentra la US Open Cup de 2023, misma que ganÃ³ con el Houston Dynamo al Inter Miami de Messi. Clausura 2017 y Apertura 2018 con Tauro, mÃ¡s el ascenso con Cartagena de EspaÃ±a en 2020.
Adalberto Carrasquilla ha firmado un contrato â€˜de larga duraciÃ³nâ€™, donde no se dio detalle de hasta quÃ© aÃ±o estarÃ¡ ligado, pero se prevÃ© jugarÃ¡ un rol importante en los Pumas.
Te recomendamos: Detienen a Billy Ãlvarez, ex presidente de Cruz Azul, tras cuatro aÃ±os de estar prÃ³fugo
Con el fichaje del panameÃ±o, Pumas de momento suma 2 incorporaciones de talla internacional, ya que hace unos dÃ­as tambiÃ©n confirmaron al portero MÃ©xico-espaÃ±ol Alex Padilla.

author: Sam Panayotovich
title: Caitlin Clark fever impacts WNBA odds: 'Her skills remind me of a young Steph Curry' | Fox News
text: As the Caitlin Clark hype train rolls toward the WNBA , everybody wants a piece.Clark signed endorsement deals with the likes of Buick, Gatorade, Goldman Sachs, Hy-Vee, Nike, State Farm and Topps, while breaking basketball records at the University of Iowa â€” and her skyrocketing brand is showing zero signs of slowing down.She even stole the show on " Saturday Night Live " for crying out loud.Clarkâ€™s next chapter is professional basketball, where sheâ€™ll join an Indiana Fever squad that finished 13-27 a season ago. Sheâ€™ll pair with fellow No. 1 overall pick Aliyah Boston (2023) with sights set on laying the foundation for the Wâ€™s next powerhouse.Like all good things, though, itâ€™ll take time.Legendary Las Vegas bookmaker Robert Walker is probably the biggest womenâ€™s basketball fan who works in the betting racket. He cut his teeth at the Stardust and MGM back in the day, and currently directs the sportsbook operation at BetLeroyâ€™s."Iâ€™m a bookmaker, but Iâ€™m a fan first," Walker told FOX Sports. "I remember when Diana Taurasi came into the league. There was certainly a buzz when she got drafted, but this is an entirely different conversation. The appetite to consume Clark is second to none."Nobody has grown the womenâ€™s game more than Caitlin Clark."The league is already giving Clark and the Fever the Beatles treatment, as theyâ€™ll play 36 of their 40 regular-season games on national television. No pressure. However, Walker cautions those who believe Clark will come in right away and dominate the sport the way she dominated the Big Ten and the NCAA womenâ€™s tournament."There will be nights sheâ€™ll score 30 and others sheâ€™ll score eight," Walker said. "Thatâ€™s life as a rookie. The competition is significantly stronger and players are bigger and faster across the board. I think Clark is a decent defender, but guarding Jewell Loyd and Kelsey Plum and Arike Ogunbowale is a different story."You also have to remember most WNBA rookies deal with the eventual burnout after a 30-game collegiate season, let alone a superstar who carried all that extra pressure to another deep Final Four run. Fatigue tends to kick in for everyone in that first year."Reminder: the WNBAâ€™s regular season begins on May 14.I'm tired just thinking about that turnaround.Walker estimates Clark is already three points better than the average WNBA player, but itâ€™s difficult to price her true value to the betting line without a single game under her belt. That said, thereâ€™s no ignoring Clarkâ€™s ceiling. Everybody knows about her scoring, but Walker gushes about her innate court vision and passing ability. He knows assists can be deceiving, too. How many times did Clark draw double or triple coverage, only to zip a pass to a wide-open Hawkeye teammate who missed a bunny?"Her skills remind me of a young Steph Curry ," Walker said. "The ball handling, the vision, the range out to 30 feet. Weâ€™ve never seen a player in the WNBA shoot like she can."Clark is the current favorite to win Rookie of the Year (-600) and as low as 12/1 for MVP.As for team goals, Indiana is probably thinking playoffs for the upcoming campaign. But in a league with two super teams â€” the Las Vegas Aces and New York Liberty â€” the rebuilding Fever are understandably a few years away from going toe-to-toe with the leagueâ€™s best.Las Vegas is currently even money (+100) to win the WNBA championship at one American sportsbook, followed closely by New York (+230). Then thereâ€™s everybody else. Seattle (+1000), Connecticut (+1200), Dallas (+2400), Phoenix (+2400) all have shorter odds than Indiana (+3300), followed by Atlanta (+4200), Minnesota (+4200), Chicago (+6500), Washington (+8500) and Los Angeles (+10000).How many wins is fair?"I would open [Indianaâ€™s total] 20.5," Walker said. "You have to consider how theyâ€™ll bet you. The season hasnâ€™t started yet and Indianaâ€™s a fan favorite. The team will be better, though. Boston will improve in Year 2 and NaLyssa Smith missed 10 games last year."Theyâ€™re still a middle-of-the-pack team with deficiencies. Asking Clark to carry Indiana to a WNBA championship is a more daunting task than winning a national title at Iowa. Las Vegas doesnâ€™t have any holes and New York is a juggernaut."So yeah, I would open just north of 20. And Iâ€™m not moving that number either way until one of my sharp players makes a move. If somebody bets you â€˜Over,â€™ you scoot the number up. The truth is, there are probably others waiting to come â€˜Underâ€™ 21.5."The money always tells the story." Sam Panayotovich is a sports betting analyst for FOX Sports and NESN. He previously worked for WGN Radio, NBC Sports and VSiN. He'll probably pick against your favorite team. Follow him on Twitter @ spshoot .
